data.title: Fragrant pho
data.text: Unpretentious and unprepossessing restaurant in what I suspect is a former retail store in a strip mall type setting serving excellently flavored pho...fragrant with the star anise and other flavorings but not as "beefy" a stock as I have had other places. IVung Tau was the site of a delightful and simple lunch.  I had pho without noodles; great assortment of beef, meatballs, and tripe in a nice broth. It is a pleasure to find a family-owned and operated place in a city awash in chains (and which city isn't?).  Ban mi (sandwich) is reported to be excellent.  (For my host, it was his "regular."order.)  The restaurant seems happy to meet any request (meatless pho, for example,; extra cilantro, for another).  How lucky the folks of Lincoln are to have a plethora of Vietnamese restaurant options, of which, my host tells me, this was the best.  It certainly was good. Wish I lived closer!

data.title: Not what I expected.
data.text: First, I am not a Vietnamese food expert.  This review is just based on my taste buds.  My wife and I went here for lunch and she ordered a large bowl of Pho with flank steak and some other meat in it.  I ordered a chicken breast and shredded pork over rice.  My dish looked half normal with the chicken breast on one side, but on the other side was what looked like caramelized onions.  Whatever it was, it did not taste like pork or have the consistency of pork.  It tasted like a powdery substance of some kind.  It was not good.  The chicken breast was fine, but quite plane.  The soup looked quite good, however, it was fairly run of the mill as well.  Plain beef stock with some noodled and meat in it.  There was some good meat, but some very rubbery meat as well.  Overall, not very good either.  The place is much larger than you think and the staff is friendly.  After this visit, we probably will not be back.  It's just not the cuisine we are looking for.

data.title: Authentic Vietnamese and Delicious!
data.text: I just ate at this great restaurant.  It is on 27th St. in the heart of the City.  It is Vietnamese like I remember tasting long ago.  We had Chicken in a Beef Noodle soup.  You add bean sprouts, lime, spices, mint leaves.  We had a mixed dish of some of the favorites.  So fresh tasting and delicious.  We ordered egg rolls.  The sauce is oh so good.  Don't miss this gem of a place located on 27th and Y St.  We will definitely be back.

data.title: A hidden gem!
data.text: You have to seek this one out, but it is worth the effort. I especially love the bun with salad shrimp -- very fresh and delicious. And their spring rolls are the best in town, no question. They had made an effort to clean up and decorate, but it's the food we come back for.

data.title: Best Pho is Lincoln!
data.text: We meet people from all over who come to enjoy the great food here.  We have watched the kids grow up to be waiters and enjoy the calm friendly atmosphere.  Banh mi, pho, bun, everything is simply great!

data.title: My favorite Pho
data.text: I used to frequent this little gem when I was a student in the uni. During winter I opted for the delicious Pho and in the summer I'd go with their lovely Bun. The family who owned it was really friendly as well and the service was fast. I still often crave their Pho til today.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: I love this place!  Such a refreshing change to have a family owned restaurant instead of a predictable chain.  Food is fresh and yummy.  Service is decent.  Atmosphere is simple and clean. I had a noodle bowl every time I ate here and it was consistently good.  This is on my short list of places to eat in Lincoln.  I would not hesitate to recommend this to diners who want an authentic Vietnamese meal.

data.title: Great pho!
data.text: I always like coming here for pho. They have a lot of good-sounding items on the menu, but I stick to my favorite. I also get the fried egg rolls. They have also expanded the space & it's quite nice. Go here for good pho!

data.title: My favorite vietnamese restaurant and Pho in Lincoln
data.text: Yes, the one across the street from Vung Tau is more elegant but the food across the street is not as good.  It used to be that one wouldn't go to Vung Tau for a date night because it was a bit shabby but now that they've expanded and are more like a restaurant than a corner store.  As a result I have no reason to go to any place else if I'm in the mood for Pho which I often am.  The place is run by a friendly family.  My only complaint are the hours.  They close at 7.  Much MUCH too early for my tastes.   But I suppose that's because it's a family endeavor and not a true let's maximize profits kind of place.  The quality of the food is wonderful.  While I'm not Asian, I've been to Vietnam and Vung Tau doesn't disappoint.  DId I mention that it's also much cheaper than the shiny new place across the street?  I'm always shocked by how low my bill is at Vung Tau.  It was less than $11 for carryout of Pho and Spring rolls last week.  And that was plenty for two people.

data.title: Excellent quality food, wonderful service!
data.text: Wow...the food was exquisite. We mentioned it was our first visit and the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Recommendations were spot-on and they explained what condiments worked best with what. The Pho was bursting with so many different levels of flavor, and the grilled pork chop with rice was delicious as well! Will definitely be going back. If you are looking for a fancy place, this is not it. But bright and clean and simple. Not expensive. They could easily charge more for the quality they are serving up! Kicking myself for not taking any pictures of the food.

data.title: Food is alright, service was terrible!
data.text: The food here is alright but the service here is just terrible. Our waiter, Scotty, seemed to just mind his own business as I was doing everything I could to get more water. Not only that but he was extremely rude and his family came and made everything worse! Oh and if you come in with some friends, expect to share ONE plate of vegetables. That's right, one plate for four people. You could ask for more but they charge a ridiculous amount. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!

data.title: Great soup, great noodles
data.text: One of the best pho I've tasted! The place is small and cannot accommodate that many people so try to go during non-peak hours.

data.title: Little Family Vietnamese Restaurant
data.text: The Bun was good. Service was good. Unfortunately, they were out of bubble tea when we were there.

data.title: Best Vietnamese food in town!!!!
data.text: I love this place!!!!! The pho is excellent and I love the rice noodle bowls. Avoid going Sunday lunch because you'll probably have to wait for a table. Don't miss out on the sandwiches or bubble tea!!!

data.title: very good soups, they could improve the appareance of the place
data.text: Simple, a lot of people from vietnam are always eating there (which give you the feeling that this is the real deal) the flavors are great and the price is right. Good friendly service, a little slow sometime. I wish the place would be cleaner and a better mantainance, that is a issue for me. Apart of that this restaurant is a great place to enjoy some cuisine from vietnam

data.title: just like vietnam
data.text: I have been going here for at least 5 years now and let me tell you, you will never be disappointed.  The other day i went here with my aunt and cousin for lunch, i had the Com Thit Nuong Bi Cha (Grilled pork special) and my aunt and cousin had the regular com thit nuong with honey dew bubble tea.  It was amazing, total bill was $22 and i still think the price of bubble tea is expensive at $3.75( same at every vietnamese restaurant).  The food is amazing and is as authentic as it gets since it is family owned. Simply the best vietnamese in town period! and i have been to them all

data.title: Einfach gut.
data.text:
Ich war mit Arbeitskollegen in der Mittagspause im Vung Tau Restaurant. Von Außen ist der Laden auf den ersten Blick nicht besonders attraktiv. Als wir den Laden betraten, der mir von den Kollegen empfohlen wurde, war ich erstmal von der Anzahl der Gäste überrascht. Ein Restaurant, was tagsüber so gut gefüllt ist, kann ja nicht schlecht sein, dachte ich.

Wer ein gediegenes Restaurant erwartet, der wird enttäuscht. Das Lokal ist einfach und schmucklos gehalten und die Sitze sind nicht besonders bequem.

Das Essen jedoch ist großartig, ausreichend portioniert und wird in kurzer Zeit an den Tisch gebracht. Ich kenne mich mit vietnamesischen Essen nicht aus, daher kann ich nur sagen, dass das Schweinefleisch sehr lecker war. Auch die Suppen meiner Kollegen hätten mich reizen können. 

Es ist zu vermuten, dass ich nicht das letzte mal dort gegessen habe.

Die Preise sind günstig und alle Gerichte können auch mitgenommen werden.
